title: Drawing, "First Designs for Ickworth House, Suffolk, England", ca. 1800
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on paper
signed: Signed at lower left: "Mario Asprucci Romano dis."
inscribed:
Inscribed on the portico: Tranquillitate Et Amicis
Indication of scale in pen and black ink in Piedi Inglesi
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Front elevation of a two-story circular building with engaged columns and with an open loggia below, approached by a flight of stairs.  At either side, connected by wings, are domed, one-story pavilions with colonnades.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "First Designs for Ickworth House, Suffolk, England", ca. 1800.
ca. 1800. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7172.
